newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to buy Apple stake-Jobs.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to buy Apple stake-Jobs.

text.p: Apple Computer Inc.'s Steve Jobs Wednesday said Microsoft Corp. will buy $150 million of the struggling computer company's stock and will take other steps to help the company.
Jobs, speaking at the Macworld Expo conference in Boston, also said the company revamped its entire board, naming four new board members including himself.

Jobs said Microsoft will buy the stock at market prices over the next three years. He said Microsoft's stake in Apple is a non-voting interest and Microsoft has agreed not to sell its shares for at least three years.
Jobs also told the MacWorld Conference here that three board members, including early financier and one-time Chairman A.C. Mike Markkula, resigned.

The new board members include Oracle Corp. Chairman Larry Ellison, one-time International Business Machines Corp. Chief Financial Officer Jerry York, Intuit Inc. President William Campbell, and Jobs, who returned to the company in December as a part-time strategic adviser.
"We're adding a tremendous amount of industry expertise," Jobs told Apple customers and investors at the trade show.
